creator: chrisw@wolfram.com
text:
Our setup consists of a CATALINA_BASE that is something different than 
CATALINA_HOME.  With this configuration, we place some jar files into the 
shared/lib directory in CATALINA_HOME.  If we do this, classes in these jar 
files _cannot_ be found.  If the jar files are placed in common/lib then the 
classes _can_ be found.  If we place the jar files in a shared/lib directory in 
CATALINA_BASE the classes _cannot_ be found.  If we do not establish a 
CATALINA_BASE and place the jar files only in shared lib, the classes _can_ be 
found.  

So it seems that when you use classes that are shared while using 
CATALINA_BASE, you _must_ use common.  However, this is not true if you do not 
set CATALINA_BASE, you should use shared in this case.  It seems like you would 
want shared to work for both of these cases.  

Also it would be helpful if shared was based out of CATALINA_BASE.  The 
documentation says that it is based out of CATALINA_HOME.  However, there are 
some messages that refer to it being in CATALINA_BASE.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
There have been some recent fixes to the documentation to correct a couple of 
errors. To clarify:

common is relative to CATALINA_HOME
server is relative to CATALINA_HOME
shared is relative to CATALINA_BASE

If this is not the case for you, please re-open this report and attach a 
simple test case (ready to run war) and any jars that need to be placed in 
common/server/shared to reproduce the problem.

I have reviewed the relevant parts of the tomcat source and I can't see any 
problems.
